newsitem.title: FINLAND: ARCTOS TO ISSUE NEW SHARES, TARGETS GROWTH.
newsitem.headline: ARCTOS TO ISSUE NEW SHARES, TARGETS GROWTH.

text.p: Finnish investment company Arctos Capital said in a statement on Friday that it would up its share capital by up to 48 million markka in a share issue to support its growth strategy.
"Arctos Securities will take subscriptions from June 10," it said, adding the share issue would be exempt from current shareholders' rights.

"The issue's intention is to support the company's growth strategy, improve the share's liquidity and expand the ownership base to institutional investors," it said. An extraordinary shareholders meetingn on June 25 would set the issue terms.
Private investment group Thominvest which is owned by the Jouhki family owns 44.5 percent of Arctos Capital.
